title: PROOF: The Affirmative Action Committee's Formation Was a Foundational Breach of the 2020 DNC MOU
stakes: West Virginia's minority communities were disenfranchised at the moment the committee meant to empower them was created.
thesis: The WVDP violated the 2020 MOU by installing pre-selected leadership before forming required caucuses, creating an illegitimate committee.

axioms.text: Selina Vickers was the lead Challenger whose complaint triggered the 2020 MOU.
axioms.citation: 2020 MOU between WVDP and DNC RBC

axioms.text: The MOU required the AAC be formed with members 'selected by their particular caucus.'
The MOU mandated the State Party 'fully implement... the creation of any new... caucuses.'
The MOU required the process be conducted 'under the supervision... of representatives of the RBC.'
Only the African American caucus existed when AAC formation began in June 2021.

rule_summary: Caucuses must exist before they can select representatives. The RBC must supervise this process.

case_facts.text: The formation used a script marked 'do not share.'
The script admitted the committee was 'missing... Latino's, Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders, and Native Americans.'
The script pre-selected the leadership slate before caucuses could participate.
Vickers scripted her own appointment as Parliamentarian.

logic_chain: The MOU required a caucus-driven process supervised by the RBC.
The State Party used a secret script instead.
The script proves they knew 75% of racial caucuses were missing.
They installed leadership anyway, excluding these groups.
The RBC failed to intervene despite its supervisory duty.
[DJ-MARK] An illegitimate committee was born from a rigged process.
violation: The WVDP and RBC violated the MOU's 'caucus-first mandate' by creating a committee through a secret process that excluded required groups. This foundational breach rendered the AAC illegitimate from inception.

title: PROOF: WVDP Failed to Properly Implement DNC-Mandated Diversity Plan
stakes: Minority caucuses were denied their right to select committee leadership.
thesis: The WVDP violated the 2020 MOU by installing AAC leadership before establishing required diversity caucuses.

axioms.text: The 2020 MOU's purpose was to 'establish new... diversity caucuses.'
axioms.citation: 2020 MOU between WVDP and DNC RBC, p. 1

axioms.text: Selina Vickers was appointed to 'oversee and direct compliance' with the MOU.
axioms.citation: 2020 MOU between WVDP and DNC RBC, p. 2

axioms.text: The AAC required co-chairs from African American, Native American, Asian/Pacific Islander, and Latino caucuses.
axioms.citation: 2020 MOU between WVDP and DNC RBC, p. 1-2

axioms.text: As of June 2021, only the African American caucus existed.

rule_summary: Caucuses must exist and select their representatives before the AAC can be formed.

case_facts.text: The WVDP installed AAC leadership on June 5, 2021.
Three of four required racial caucuses did not exist at installation.
Vickers circulated a pre-written script on June 2 dictating the formation.
case_facts.citation: Draft Script Email June 2; Selina Script

logic_chain: The MOU required diversity caucuses to form the AAC.
Leadership was installed on June 5, 2021.
75% of racial caucuses didn't exist yet.
Non-existent caucuses couldn't select representatives.
[DJ-MARK] The WVDP violated the MOU's core requirement.
violation: The WVDP violated the 2020 MOU by forming the AAC before required caucuses existed, disenfranchising minority groups from selecting their own leadership.

title: PROOF: Script's Detail Proves Deliberate Exclusion of Mandated Caucuses
stakes: The committee's foundational decisions lacked mandated representation from 75% of racial diversity groups.
thesis: The script's exhaustive detail proves organizers deliberately excluded Latino, AAPI, and Native American caucuses.

axioms.text: The MOU required an AAC with members from each diversity group 'selected by their particular caucus.'
axioms.citation: 2020 MOU between WVDP and DNC RBC, p. 2-3

axioms.text: Required groups included African Americans, Native Americans, Asian/Pacific Islanders, and Latinos.
axioms.citation: 2020 MOU between WVDP and DNC RBC, p. 2

axioms.text: Selina Vickers authored the AAC formation script.
Only the African American caucus existed in June 2021.

rule_summary: All diversity caucuses must exist and select representatives before the AAC can be legitimately formed.

case_facts.text: The script dictated specific nominators and verbatim speeches.
The script acknowledged missing 'Latinos, Asian Americans/Pacific Islanders and Native Americans.'
The script designated Kim Felix for a Latino seat despite no Latino caucus existing.

logic_chain: The script shows meticulous planning capacity.
It documents knowledge that 75% of racial caucuses were missing.
Detailed planning plus documented knowledge equals intent.
They proceeded anyway, choosing exclusion.
[DJ-MARK] The organizers deliberately violated the MOU.
violation: The organizers deliberately violated the MOU by forming the AAC while knowingly excluding 75% of required racial caucusesâ€”a calculated act of disenfranchisement.

title: PROOF: AAC Leadership Selection Was Procedurally Invalid
stakes: The committee's leadership was selected through a secret process, not openly as required.
thesis: The AAC leadership election violated DNC Charter requirements by using a secret, pre-arranged script.

axioms.text: The DNC Charter requires 'full, timely and equal opportunities to participate' in selecting officers.
The Democratic Party 'shall be open to all who desire to support the Party.'
Selina Vickers was the DNC-appointed MOU compliance officer.
axioms.citation: 2020 MOU between WVDP and DNC RBC, p. 2

axioms.text: The AAC formation meeting was scheduled for June 5, 2021.

rule_summary: Officer selection must be public with equal opportunity for all to participate.

case_facts.text: The script was marked 'DRAFT SCRIPT - do not share.'
The script dictated nominations: 'Mary Ann nominates Hollis Lewis.'
The 'do not share' instruction proves awareness of wrongdoing.

logic_chain: The election used a secret script.
It was explicitly marked 'do not share.'
It pre-determined the candidate slate.
Secret processes violate open meeting requirements.
[DJ-MARK] The secrecy proves consciousness of guilt.
violation: Using a secret script to dictate pre-arranged leadership violated the DNC Charter's requirements for open processes. The secrecy instruction proves they knew it was wrong.

title: PROOF: Script Author Orchestrated Her Own Appointment
stakes: The MOU's lead Challenger used her script to install herself with procedural control over the committee.
thesis: Selina Vickers wrote herself into the Parliamentarian role through her own script.

axioms.text: The Democratic Party requires officials conduct themselves creditably.
Selina Vickers was the lead Challenger who triggered the 2020 MOU.
axioms.citation: 2020 MOU between WVDP and DNC RBC

axioms.text: Vickers authored the AAC formation meeting script.

rule_summary: Officials cannot use their position to gain power through self-appointment.

case_facts.text: The script directs: 'I nominate Selina Vickers for Parliamentarian/Secretary.'
The script includes praise: 'no one else remotely qualified.'
Parliamentarian controls procedures, interpretations, and records.

logic_chain: Vickers authored the meeting script.
Her script nominated herself.
It included her own endorsement.
The role gave her procedural control.
[DJ-MARK] She wrote herself into power.
violation: The lead Challenger used her authority to orchestrate her own installation into a key role with procedural control, violating ethical standards.

title: PROOF: Script Reveals Pre-Planned Strategy to Control Dissent
stakes: The meeting was designed to execute a predetermined outcome, not foster open participation.
thesis: The script contained tactics to challenge attendees and manage criticism, proving controlled execution over open deliberation.

axioms.text: DNC Charter mandates 'all meetings... shall be open to the public.'
The AAC was formed under the 2020 MOU.
axioms.citation: 2020 MOU between WVDP and DNC RBC

axioms.text: Selina Vickers was appointed to oversee MOU compliance.
axioms.citation: 2020 MOU between WVDP and DNC RBC, p. 2

rule_summary: Open meetings require spontaneous participation, not pre-planned control mechanisms.

case_facts.text: Script includes challenge: 'I thought this meeting was solely for co-chairs.'
Script anticipates Party Chair criticism as 'scolding.'
Script provides response strategies for opposition.

logic_chain: The script planned to challenge observers.
It anticipated and trivialized opposition.
It provided management strategies.
This proves predetermined outcomes.
[DJ-MARK] Opposition management violates open deliberation.
violation: Prepared tactics for managing participation and pre-characterizing criticism violate the DNC Charter's 'open meetings' principle.

title: PROOF: Undisclosed Conflict of Interest Corrupted Committee Process
stakes: A biased external actor with undisclosed agenda oversaw critical vote.
thesis: AAC leadership brought in Larry Taylor without disclosing his conflict of interest as Vickers' political associate.

axioms.text: DNC Charter requires 'full, timely and equal opportunities to participate.'
The Democratic Party requires officials conduct themselves creditably.
Larry Taylor founded PDPR.
Selina Vickers serves as PDPR's WV Chair.
Taylor and Vickers train together on 'beating the establishment' with rules.
Committee democratically rejected restrictive rules in August.
axioms.citation: Gmail - Fwd: General Inquiry, RE: AAC information.pdf, p. 2
axioms.url: /files/Gmail - Fwd: General Inquiry, RE: AAC information.pdf

rule_summary: Presiding officers must be impartialâ€”undisclosed conflicts violate fairness principles.

case_facts.text: Leadership brought Taylor to preside over revisiting rejected issues.
case_facts.citation: Gmail - Re: Updated agenda and information about presiding officer.pdf, p. 1
case_facts.url: /files/Gmail - Re: Updated agenda and information about presiding officer.pdf

case_facts.text: Member praised Taylor's 'impartiality'â€”conflict wasn't disclosed.
case_facts.citation: Gmail - Re: Updated agenda and information about presiding officer.pdf, p. 1
case_facts.url: /files/Gmail - Re: Updated agenda and information about presiding officer.pdf

case_facts.text: Dissenter left in protest citing 'clear ties between Ms. Vickers and Mr. Taylor.'
case_facts.citation: Gmail - Re: Updated agenda and information about presiding officer.pdf, p. 3
case_facts.url: /files/Gmail - Re: Updated agenda and information about presiding officer.pdf

logic_chain: Committee blocked restrictive rules democratically.
Leadership brought external actor Taylor.
Taylor was Vickers' PDPR founder and co-trainer.
Conflict concealed but recognized by dissenters.
[DJ-MARK] They brought a ringer to force rejected agenda.
violation: Using an external actor with severe undisclosed conflict to officiate violated ethical standards, subverted democracy, and invalidated proceedings.

title: PROOF: DNC Official Violated MOU by Advising Strategy Against Dissenting Members
stakes: A DNC official corrupted the democratic process he was tasked to oversee.
thesis: DNC Rules Committee member Harold Ickes advised a non-voting appointee to 'outvote' elected minority members.

axioms.text: The MOU's purpose was an 'open and transparent process' with 'full, timely, and equal opportunity.'
axioms.citation: 2020 MOU between WVDP and DNC RBC, p. 1

axioms.text: The RBC's role was 'supervision and technical assistance.'
axioms.citation: 2020 MOU between WVDP and DNC RBC, p. 1-2

axioms.text: Harold Ickes was a DNC RBC member during the MOU period.
Selina Vickers was appointed Parliamentarian, a non-voting position.
Seth Sturm and Mari were elected caucus co-chairs.

rule_summary: Advising to neutralize elected members violates the MOU's 'open process' mandate.

case_facts.text: Mary Ann Claytor wrote: 'disturbing to hear Harold admit he advised Selina to 'outvote' Seth, Mari, and others.'
case_facts.citation: Email from Mary Ann Claytor, Sept. 23, 2021

logic_chain: Ickes served on the oversight committee.
The MOU required 'open process' and 'full participation.'
He advised 'outvoting' elected members.
This undermines participation and exceeds 'supervision.'
[DJ-MARK] A DNC official corrupted the process he supervised.
violation: DNC official Ickes violated the MOU and Charter by advising strategy to neutralize elected members, exceeding his supervisory role and corrupting the process.

title: PROOF: Coordinated Smear Campaign Against Dissenting AAC Members
stakes: Elected minority leaders were neutralized through public attacks and procedural manipulation.
thesis: A coordinated campaign discredited minority caucus leaders through scripted attacks and invalid procedures.

axioms.text: The Democratic Party requires officials conduct themselves creditably.
Harold Ickes advised Selina Vickers to 'outvote' dissenters.
axioms.citation: Email from Mary Ann Claytor, Sept. 23, 2021

axioms.text: Seth Sturm was an elected caucus co-chair.

rule_summary: Coordinated campaigns to discredit members violate ethical conduct requirements.

case_facts.text: Vickers scripted attacks with instruction: 'DO NOT FORWARD THIS EMAIL.'
case_facts.citation: Selina asking a Senior Caucus member to attack Seth Sturm.pdf, p. 5
case_facts.url: /files/Selina asking a Senior Caucus member to attack Seth Sturm.pdf

case_facts.text: A co-chair accused Vickers of spreading 'a vicious rumor that I am dangerous.'
case_facts.citation: Gmail - Re: Updated agenda and information about presiding officer.pdf, p. 3
case_facts.url: /files/Gmail - Re: Updated agenda and information about presiding officer.pdf

case_facts.text: Shane initiated multi-day campaign calling dissenter 'toxic bully and saboteur.'

logic_chain: Multiple attack vectors were deployed.
Covert: scripted attacks with hidden authorship.
Overt: public smears and personal rumors.
Procedural: invalid meetings to overturn votes.
[DJ-MARK] Coordinated campaign silenced elected members.
violation: A coordinated campaign of covert scripts, public smears, and procedural manipulation violated the Charter's ethical conduct requirements and fair participation mandate.

title: PROOF: AAC Nullified Valid Vote to Exclude Minority Caucus Chairs
stakes: Indigenous and Black caucus chairs were denied subcommittee seats.
thesis: AAC leadership violated the MOU by nullifying a vote and excluding minority chairs through invalid proceedings.

axioms.text: The MOU's purpose was 'full participation... with particular concern for minority groups.'
axioms.citation: 2020 MOU between WVDP and DNC RBC, p. 1

axioms.text: Seth Sturm was Indigenous Caucus co-chair.
Mary Ann Claytor was Black Caucus co-chair.
The AAC had formed Planning and Bylaws subcommittees.

rule_summary: Excluding minority representatives through invalid proceedings violates the diversity mandate.

case_facts.text: Committee voted for volunteer-based subcommittees; leadership declared 'by appointment.'
case_facts.citation: Gmail - Re: General Inquiry, RE: AAC information.pdf, p. 2, 3
case_facts.url: /files/Gmail - Re: General Inquiry, RE: AAC information.pdf

case_facts.text: Leadership denied Indigenous and Black chairs subcommittee seats.
case_facts.citation: Gmail - Fwd: Planning & Bylaws Committees.pdf, p. 1

case_facts.text: Leadership passed 'Resolution Affirming Support' for themselves.
Appeals Board ruled the meeting violated bylaws.
case_facts.citation: Resolution of the Board of Appeals, Nov. 29, 2021

logic_chain: Committee voted for inclusive system.
Leadership declared appointment-only.
They excluded Indigenous and Black chairs.
Used invalid meeting to formalize exclusion.
[DJ-MARK] Pattern systematically violated inclusion mandate.
violation: AAC leadership violated the MOU by nullifying democratic decisions and using invalid proceedings to exclude minority caucus chairs, defeating the MOU's core purpose.

title: PROOF: DNC Official Deliberately Mislabeled Bylaws to Circumvent Notice Requirements
stakes: Members were denied their statutory 30-day notice for bylaw amendments.
thesis: Selina Vickers mislabeled bylaws as 'procedural rules' to circumvent mandatory notice requirements.

axioms.text: Vickers taught 'How to use rules, procedures and bylaws to beat the establishment.'
WVDP Bylaws require 30 days written notice for amendments.
axioms.citation: WVDP Bylaws, Article XI, Section A

axioms.text: Rules governing organizational authority are bylaws, not procedural rules.
Larry Taylor founded PDPR where Vickers was WV Chair.

rule_summary: Vickers' documented expertise in procedural manipulation reveals deliberate circumvention.

case_facts.text: Rule 13: 'Co-Chairs... shall have all authority... between meetings.'
Rule 14 granted power to appoint/remove subcommittee members.
Document titled 'temporary procedural rules' sent <24 hours before meeting.
Member identified: 'it's not a procedural rule for handling this meeting.'
After rejection, subcommittee 'unanimously adopted' the content.
PDPR colleague Taylor presided over September 16 meeting adopting mislabeled bylaws.

logic_chain: Vickers knew from PDPR training how to manipulate rules.
Rules 13-14 were bylaws requiring 30-day notice.
She labeled them 'temporary procedural rules' with <24 hours notice.
Members recognized and called out the deception.
Her PDPR colleague ensured adoption anyway.
[DJ-MARK] Deliberate mislabeling circumvented notice requirements.
violation: Vickers violated WVDP Bylaws by deliberately mislabeling bylaws as 'procedural rules' to circumvent 30-day notice. Her PDPR training proves intent. Rules adopted through this deception are void.

title: PROOF: PAC Treasurer's Signature Was Forged on Financial Reports
umbrella_category: A New Day PAC Campaign Finance Violations
stakes: Multiple sworn financial reports were filed with forged signatures.
thesis: A New Day PAC filed reports with the treasurer's forged signature after she resigned.

axioms.text: Campaign finance reports must be signed by the treasurer.
Filing false reports is a criminal offense.
Kim Felix served as PAC treasurer until her resignation.
axioms.citation: A New Day PAC registration records

rule_summary: Only the actual treasurer can sign financial reportsâ€”forgery voids the filing.

case_facts.text: Felix resigned as treasurer citing ethical concerns.
Reports filed after resignation contain her signature.
case_facts.citation: A New Day PAC Q2 2023 Filing

case_facts.text: Felix confirmed she did not sign these reports.

logic_chain: Felix resigned as treasurer.
Reports filed after resignation bear her signature.
She confirms she didn't sign them.
Someone else signed her name.
[DJ-MARK] The PAC filed reports with forged signatures.
violation: A New Day PAC violated campaign finance law by filing reports with forged treasurer signatures, constituting false swearing and undermining the integrity of public disclosure.

title: PROOF: Unreported Financial Activity - The Scholarship Program
umbrella_category: A New Day PAC Campaign Finance Violations
stakes: A PAC concealed its scholarship program from required disclosures.
thesis: A New Day PAC failed to report any financial activity for its formal scholarship program.

axioms.text: All political committee expenditures must be publicly reported.
Any 'thing of value' received must be reported as in-kind contribution.
A New Day PAC was registered as a West Virginia political committee.
The PAC previously paid Progressive Democrats for Party Reform for consulting.
axioms.citation: A New Day PAC Q4 2022 Filing

rule_summary: All financial transactions must be reportedâ€”scholarships involve reportable transactions.

case_facts.text: PAC solicited scholarship applications on August 22, 2023.
Q3 2023 report shows zero expenditures to trainer.
case_facts.citation: A New Day PAC Q3 2023 Filing

case_facts.text: Q3 2023 report shows zero in-kind contributions.
case_facts.citation: A New Day PAC Q3 2023 Filing

logic_chain: PAC offered scholarships August 22, 2023.
Scholarships require reportable transactions.
Q3 2023 report contains neither expenditures nor in-kind contributions.
Absence means concealment from disclosure.
[DJ-MARK] PAC's sworn disclosure omits scholarship program.
violation: A New Day PAC violated campaign finance law by failing to report scholarship program financial activity, denying public transparency and rendering sworn statements incomplete.
potential_remedies: File corrected report disclosing all scholarship activity.
Provide public accounting of funding and recipients.
